Standard pathway list

Standard pathway list

Promote links to standard content within the context of a page.

    On this page
  • Overview
  • Anatomy
  • Usage rules
  • Layouts

Overview

Appearance

Standard pathway

The standard pathway is an in-page link to another page on the site.

Default - Heading 3 (desktop)
h3 {
    font-family: OpenSans-Semibold;
    font-size: 21px;
    color: #333333;
    letter-spacing: 0;
    line-height: 28px;
}
h3:hover {
    color: #254F90;
    text-decoration: underline;
}
Default - Heading 3 (mobile)
h3 {    
    font-family: OpenSans-Semibold;
    font-size: 21px;
    color: #333333;
    letter-spacing: 0;
    line-height: 30px;
}
Other options
Heading 4 - See typography guidelines

Purpose

Generally used as a default option within index pages or to build page hierarchy as a secondary weight against hero and light pathways.

Anatomy

Standard pathway elements

Title

The title of the linked page.

Default - Heading 3 (desktop)
h3 {
    font-family: OpenSans-Semibold;
    font-size: 21px;
    color: #333333;
    letter-spacing: 0;
    line-height: 28px;
}
h3:hover {
    color: #254F90;
    text-decoration: underline;
}
Default - Heading 3 (mobile)
h3 {    
    font-family: OpenSans-Semibold;
    font-size: 21px;
    color: #333333;
    letter-spacing: 0;
    line-height: 30px;
}
Other options
Heading 4 - See typography guidelines
Short description

A short description of the linked page contents.

Desktop & mobile
p {
    font-family: OpenSans;
    font-size: 16px;
    color: #333333;
    letter-spacing: 0.2px;
    line-height: 28px;
}

Icon link

.icon {    
    color: #254F90;
    height: 16px;
    width: 16px;
}
.icon:hover {
    color: #254F90;
    height: 32px;
    width: 32px;
}

Component container

.container {
    background: #ffffff;
    padding: 24px;
    border: none;
    border-top: 4px solid #254F90;
    box-shadow: 0 0.125rem 0.75rem 0 rgba(0,0,0,.2);
}
View design and assets in Adobe XD

Usage rules

Coming soon.

Layouts

Page width

Standard pathway components should only be used in full width pages.

Equal width layout

Desktop: Three equal width components in a row.

Tablet: Two equal width components in a row.

Mobile: One equal component in a row.
